wikitext.*:
'''''thanc''''' is a [[Noldorin]] word meaning "forked".<ref name=Ety>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 388</ref>

Since ''thanc'' appears in the name ''[[Orthanc#Etymology|Orthanc]]'', [[Didier Willis]] has suggested that ''thanc'' (retaining the same meaning) would be valid [[Sindarin]].<ref>[[Didier Willis]], [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/english.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/haut.shtml Jrrvf.com] (accessed 19 June 2011)</ref>

==Etymology==

The word derives from [[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]] ''sthanka'', from [[Sundocarme|root]] [[STAK]].<ref name=Ety/>

==Compounds==

*''[[Serpents#Names|Lhamthanc]]'' ("forked tongue")<ref name=Ety/>
*''[[Orthanc#Etymology|Orthanc]]'' ("forked-height")<ref>[http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names#o Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth] at [http://www.tolkiendil.com/ Tolkiendil.com] (accessed 27 June 2011)</ref>
